VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY NASHI'1LLF., TF.NNLSSE:F. 37232 Tri F rno.e 1615I 322-5000 DeparU~tcu! n/ Phdrm,~i~~ingt • Srhool of ,S1nlt2'ine • Dird<1 pharn 322220i May 20, 1987 Dr. Steve Lanier Cardiac Unit Massachusetts General Hospital Harvard Medical School Jackson-13 Boston, MA 02114 Dear Steve: I am delighted to confirm in writing our on-going collaboration to study certain structural features of the porcine brain cortex alpha2-adrenergic receptor. We are pleased to continue providing affinity-purified receptor for your analyses of the possible structural heterogeneity among alpha2-adrenergic receptors from brain, kidney, spleen and platelet. As you are well aware, recent reports suggesting the possible existence of alpha2-receptor subtypes (based on radioligand binding and functional criteria) make these studies all the more interesting and important. Best of luck in obtaining adequate funding to pursue these studies. Sincerely, YU. Lee E. Limbird, Ph.D. Professor Department of Pharmacology LEL/mc • Au Equnl Oppmhurih/AJ/trmnlti~r Adron Enplq~rr
